On Sunday 23 November 2003 1=
2:47, Daniel Paul Hightower wrote:
> How do I plan on doing this? =A0I'm go=
ing to . . "borrow" a C compiler called
> "Code Warrior" from a computer on=
 my college campus since I'm unable to
> understand how MS Visual C++ works=
, which is what I have on my pc.

Just FYI, Code Warior is actully an IDE, =
not a compiler (I don't know what 
compiler it uses).  Also, MS Visual C++ =
is generally reguarded as one of the 
best IDE's out there; if you've got t=
hat you may want to give it another try.  
Another (free) option is Dev C++=
.  That's what I usually use (when in 
windows).  The advantage of this is =
it uses mingw for the compiler, which is 
a windows port of gcc, which I'm =
fairly certain is what the OpenGlad crew is 
using.  

Bleh, maybe next sem=
ester I'll have some free time to "finish" Balder. Then 
I'd like to do a 3=
d version of (or based on) gladiator, with networked 
multiplayer capabilit=
ies.  Could be a while before I start that though.  Plus 
I have to find so=
me people to help; it's much to big a project to tackle on 
my own ;P. 

Bj=
orn
